definition: to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
thief/traitor/wily/deceitful/evil/extremely
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain

sentences.english: But I am like that kid and have a guilty conscience generally.
sentences.chinese: 而我就像那个小孩一样，做贼心虚一般。

sentences.english: A guilty man apprehends danger in every sound.
sentences.chinese: 做贼心虚者听到听到任何声响都会觉得有危险。

sentences.english: Nor ashy pale the fear that false hearts have.
sentences.chinese: 也未让苍白透露出做贼心虚的惊恐。

definition: lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
to have secret motives/to have a guilty conscience
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: to confess without being pressed/to make a confession without duress
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
to harbor ulterior motives (idiom)
in the wrong
sneaky/secretive/furtive
to get agitated/to panic
lit. show strength while weak inside (idiom); appearing fierce while cowardly at heart/a sheep in wolf's clothing

the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
confused/rattled/flustered
